001package imagingbook.lib.filter.linear;
002
003import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
004
005/**
006 * This class represents a 2D filter kernel.
007 * 
008 * @author WB
009 * @version 2020/12/29
010 */
011public class GaussianKernel1D extends Kernel1D {
012        
013        public static final double SIZE_FACTOR = 3.5;   
014        
015        public GaussianKernel1D(double sigma) {
016                super(makeGaussKernel1D(sigma));
017        }
018
019        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
020        
021        /**
022         * Creates and returns a 1D Gaussian filter kernel large enough
023         * to avoid truncation effects. The resulting array is odd-sized.
024         * The returned kernel is normalized.
025         * 
026         * @param sigma the width (standard deviation) of the Gaussian
027         * @return the Gaussian filter kernel
028         */
029        public static float[] makeGaussKernel1D(double sigma) {
030                if (sigma < 0) {
031                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("positive sigma required for Gaussian kernel");
032                }
033                final int rad = (int) Math.ceil(SIZE_FACTOR * sigma);
034                final int size = rad + rad + 1;
035                final float[] kernel = new float[size]; // odd size, center cell = kernel[rad]
036                final double sigma2 = sqr(sigma);
037                
038                for (int i = 0; i < kernel.length; i++) {
039                        kernel[i] = (float) Math.exp(-0.5 * sqr(rad - i) / sigma2);
040                }
041        
042                return normalize(kernel);
043        }
044        
045}
